caption.center: STATE OF OREGON, Respondent, v. BENJAMIN McKEEN, Appellant.

date.center: Argued January 19, reversed and remanded with instructions April 3, 1978

opinion.posture:
Appeal from District Court, Klamath County.
Ross Davis, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
Enver Bozgoz, Klamath Falls, argued the cause and filed the brief for appellant.
Donald L. Paillette, Assistant Attorney General, Salem, argued the cause for respondent. On the brief were James A. Redden, Attorney General, and Al J. Laue, Solicitor General, Salem.
opinion.panel: Before Schwab, Chief Judge, and Thornton, Tanzer and Buttler, Judges.
opinion.opinion_text:
PER CURIAM.
Reversed and remanded with instructions.Page 480
[EDITORS' NOTE: THIS PAGE IS BLANK.]Page 481

Reversed and remanded. See, State v. McKeen, 33 Or. App. 343,576 P.2d 804 (1978).
Reversed and remanded with instructions.Page 482
[EDITORS' NOTE: THIS PAGE IS BLANK.]Page 483
